issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description:
In federation mode,"hdfs dfsadmin -report" command can not be used,as follows:
hdfs@zdh102:~> hdfs dfsadmin -report
report: FileSystem viewfs://nsX/ is not an HDFS file system
Usage: hdfs dfsadmin [-report] [-live] [-dead] [-decommissioning]

After adding new features,"hdfs dfsadmin -report" command can be used,as follows:

hdfs@zdh102:~> hdfs dfsadmin -report
hdfs://nameservice
Configured Capacity: 2682939863040 (2.44 TB)
Present Capacity: 2170811387904 (1.97 TB)
DFS Remaining: 2170810589184 (1.97 TB)
DFS Used: 798720 (780 KB)
DFS Used%: 0.00%
Under replicated blocks: 0
Blocks with corrupt replicas: 0
Missing blocks: 0
Missing blocks (with replication factor 1): 0

fields.summary: In federation mode,"hdfs dfsadmin -report" command can not be used

comments.body: Hi [~lixinglong], seems like a useful patch. I don't like seeing ViewFileSystem-specific logic being added to FileSystem; that logic should live within ViewFileSystem itself. Also, pulling URIs directly from the {{dfs.nameservices}} config is definitely not the right approach here; different ViewFileSystem instances may have different backing HDFS instances. You should instead use {{ViewFileSystem#getChildFileSystems()}} which will directly return the backing HDFS instances without any URI manipulation.
[~xkrogen] Thank you very much! Has been modified in accordance with the ideas you say.

| (x) *{color:red}-1 overall{color}* |

[~xkrogen][~ajisakaa] Is there any problem？ thank you very much！

Hey [~lixinglong], v004 patch looks pretty good; I am happy to see that changes are now isolated to {{DFSAdmin}}. There are a few issues outstanding: 
* When you construct the list of {{ViewFileSystem}} child FS, you should check that they are in fact {{DistributedFileSystem}} instances, so that we can throw an appropriate {{IllegalArgumentException}} instead of a {{ClassCastException}} later.
* It seems you have removed a few outputs. The {{bytesInFuture}} outputs have disappeared altogether, as well as "Pending deletion blocks".
* I think that, for the purposes of backwards compatibility, we shouldn't print the URI (this line: {{System.out.println(dfs.getUri());}}) if a single DFS is supplied; only if a {{ViewFileSystem}} is supplied. There should be no change to output if the command is used in ways that were previously supported.
* I would also love to see tests added in {{TestDFSAdmin}}.

Also just an FYI that I am not a committer so even once you get a +1 from me it is a nonbinding vote.
